snippet: The additional advisers will aid in the rescue of displaced people trapped by jihadists on Mount Sinjar, Defense Department officials said.
abstract: Defense Department officials say that Pentagon has sent additional 130 military advisers to northern Iraq to help plan evacuation of thousands of displaced Yazidis and others trapped by Sunni militants on Mount Sinjar; move raises possibility that larger American force may eventually be needed in rescue attempt.

byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon contributed reporting from Honiara, Solomon Islands.

lead_paragraph: The additional advisers will aid in the rescue of displaced people trapped by jihadists on Mount Sinjar, Defense Department officials said.
